paper_abstract: A stable and conservative high order multi-block method for the time-dependent compressible Navier-Stokes equations has been developed. Stability and conservation are proved using summation-by-parts operators, weak interface conditions and the energy method. This development makes it possible to exploit the efficiency of the high order finite difference method for non-trivial geometries. The computational results corroborate the theoretical analysis. (C) 2009 Elsevier Inc. All rights reserved.
paper_title: A stable and conservative high order multi-block method for the compressible Navier-Stokes equations
